!Aftermath of an Israeli strike on a house, in Khan Younis in the southern Gaza Strip <image:10674>

By —

[Wafaa Shurafa, Associated Press](https://www.pbs.org/newshour/author/wafaa-shurafa-associated-press)
 [Wafaa Shurafa, Associated Press](https://www.pbs.org/newshour/author/wafaa-shurafa-associated-press)

By —

[Mariam Dagga, Associated Press](https://www.pbs.org/newshour/author/mariam-dagga-associated-press)

[Leave your feedback](https://www.pbs.org/newshour/about/contact-us/)

Month-old girl pulled from rubble in Gaza after airstrike killed her parents
============================================================================

[World](https://www.pbs.org/newshour/world)
 Mar 20, 2025 3:02 PM EDT

KHAN YOUNIS, Gaza Strip (AP) — As rescuers dug through the remains of a collapsed apartment building in Gaza’s Khan Younis on Thursday, they could hear the cries of a baby from underneath the rubble.

Suddenly, calls of “God is great” rang out. The baby girl stirred fitfully as paramedics checked her over.

Her parents and brother were dead in the overnight Israeli airstrike.

“When we asked people, they said she is a month old and she has been under the rubble, since dawn,” said Hazen Attar, a civil defense first responder. We never felt that there was stability, not at all.”

**READ MORE:** [Israeli strikes across Gaza hit multiple homes, killing at least 85 Palestinians](https://www.pbs.org/newshour/politics/israeli-strikes-across-gaza-hit-multiple-homes-killing-at-least-85-palestinians)

Israel resumed heavy strikes across Gaza on Tuesday, shattering the truce that had facilitated the release of more than two dozen hostages. Health officials said most of the victims were women and children.

The strike that destroyed the infant girl’s home hit Abasan al-Kabira, a village just outside of Khan Younis near the border with Israel, killing at least 16 people, mostly women and children, according to the nearby European Hospital, which received the dead.

It was inside an area the Israeli military ordered evacuated earlier this week, encompassing most of eastern Gaza.

Nabil Abu Dagga, a relative of Ella’s family who lives nearby, rushed to the scene of the strike.

“People were sitting together and enjoying themselves on a Ramadan night, staying up together as a family,” he said. The military did not immediately comment on the overnight strikes.

Hours later, the Israeli military restored a blockade on northern Gaza, including Gaza City, that it had maintained for most of the war, but which had been lifted under the ceasefire deal.

Hundreds of thousands of Palestinians had returned to what remains of their homes in the north after a ceasefire took hold in January.

The war began when Hamas-led militants stormed into southern Israel on Oct. 7, 2023, killing some 1,200 people and taking 251 hostage.

Israel’s blistering retaliatory air and ground offensive has killed nearly 49,000 Palestinians since then, more than half of them women and children, according to the Gaza Health Ministry. She had been born 25 days earlier, in the midst of a tenuous ceasefire that many Palestinians in Gaza had hoped would mark the end of a war that has devastated the enclave, killed tens of thousands and displaced nearly its entire population.

Only the girl’s grandparents survived the attack. Rescuers digging through the rubble could be seen pulling out the small body of a child sprawled on the mattress where he had been sleeping.

The girl’s grandmother, Fatima Abu Dagga, sat with a group of other women in a relative’s house Thursday, taking turns cradling the infant. Killed were her brother, mother and father, along with another family that included a father and his seven children. Her sons and their wives and eight grandchildren died in the bombing, and only the baby survived."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
PBS News published an article on March 20, 2025, about a month-old girl pulled from the rubble in Gaza after an Israeli airstrike killed her parents. <image:10674> The article mentions the girl's parents and brother were killed in the overnight Israeli airstrike. The war began on Oct. 7, 2023.

# Search Result
From [Source](https://www.newarab.com/news/baby-pulled-alive-rubble-after-israeli-strike-gaza): 
Content: "[Skip to main content](#main-content)

Gaza baby pulled alive from rubble after night under debris of Israeli strikes
==============================================================================

A baby was pulled alive from the rubble in Gaza after surviving the night under debris from Israeli airstrikes.

[MENA](/taxonomy/term/14 "MENA")

2 min read

Read Mode

[The New Arab Staff](/taxonomy/term/69133 "The New Arab Staff")

03 June, 2025

[](https://www.addtoany.com/share#url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.newarab.com%2Fnews%2Fbaby-pulled-alive-rubble-after-israeli-strike-gaza&title=)

   [![Palestinian journalist Anas al-Sharif shares a photo of emergency crews rescuing the baby following Israeli strikes [Anas al-Sharif/X]](/sites/default/files/styles/image_345x195/public/2025-06/GseL0W_WEAAsvuK.jpg?h=c5faa6b3&itok=tS4syRIm)](/sites/default/files/2025-06/GseL0W_WEAAsvuK.jpg)

Palestinian journalist Anas al-Sharif shares a photograph of emergency crews rescuing the baby following Israeli strikes \[Anas al-Sharif/X\]

[Gaza’s](https://www.newarab.com/news/israeli-gaza-strikes-kill-dozens-third-aid-site-opens)
 civil defence teams have been praised after rescuing a baby who was trapped overnight beneath the rubble of a destroyed home, following deadly [Israeli](https://www.newarab.com/news/huge-blasts-gaza-suggests-israel-using-suicide-apcs)
 [airstrikes](https://www.newarab.com/news/huge-blasts-gaza-suggests-israel-using-suicide-apcs)
 on the Sabra neighbourhood in Gaza City.

Emergency workers spent hours digging through the debris after the strikes flattened residential buildings, leaving civilians buried under concrete, wood, and metal. According to local reports, civil defence teams also rescued a mother and three of her children from the same area.

Mohamad Safa, a Lebanese diplomat and UN representative, wrote on X: "The baby who remained under the rubble all night in Gaza has made it safely. Share positivity."

The widely circulated images of the baby have sparked international condemnation of Israel's military campaign in Gaza and renewed attention on the toll it has taken on children.

"The picture says it all: an attempt to rescue a baby from beneath the rubble of his home. Most hospitals and medical facilities across Gaza have been damaged or destroyed.

Related

[50,000 Palestinian children killed or wounded in Gaza war](https://www.newarab.com/news/50000-palestinian-children-killed-or-wounded-gaza-war "50,000 Palestinian children killed or wounded in Gaza war")

[Gaza War](https://www.newarab.com/tag/gaza-war "Gaza War")

[MENA](https://www.newarab.com/taxonomy/term/14 "MENA")

Live Story

The New Arab Staff

The latest developments come as the United Nations Relief and Works Agency (UNRWA) reported this week that more than 50,000 Palestinian children have been killed or wounded since October 2023.

UNRWA also noted that humanitarian workers, medical personnel, and journalists continue to be killed in the course of Israel's military operations.

Earlier this year, records showed that over 38,000 Palestinian children have been orphaned and at least 13,901 women widowed since the start of Israel’s assault.

* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Search Result
From [Source](https://www.aljazeera.com/opinions/2025/5/29/israel-is-burning-gazas-children-and-the-world-lets-it-happen): 
Content: "[![](/wp-content/uploads/2023/11/Ghada-1699102185.jpg?resize=96%2C96&quality=80)](/author/ghada-ageel)

By [Ghada Ageel](/author/ghada-ageel)

Professor of political science.

Published On 29 May 202529 May 2025

![Five-year-old Ward Khalil talking about her ordeal in the ruins of a building.](/wp-content/uploads/2025/05/war-khalil-1748515400.jpg?resize=770%2C513&quality=80)

Five-year-old Ward Khalil survived an Israeli air attack early on Monday that killed her mother, two of her siblings and 33 other people \[Al Jazeera\]

Dr Alaa al-Najjar, a 36-year-old paediatrician and mother of 10, spent the morning of Friday, May 23, doing what she had devoted her life to: Saving children at Gaza’s Nasser Hospital. Two remain buried beneath the rubble, including her youngest, six-month-old Sayden, still asleep in his crib when Dr al-Najjar kissed him goodbye that morning.

In just one Israeli air strike – in just one minute – her entire world was annihilated.

Her husband Hamdy, 40, also a doctor, and their son Adam, 11, are in the ICU, their lives hanging by a thread inside Gaza’s disintegrating health system – not by chance but by design. She was one of 18,000 Palestinian children killed since October, one of 1,300+ since Israel broke the ceasefire in March, and one of dozens in just 48 hours.

Commenting on the moral double standards applied to Palestinians, Dan Sheehan, editor at Literary Hub, noted: “If an 11-year-old Israeli influencer – a girl who delivered food and toys to displaced children – had been killed, the Empire State Building would be lit up for her. Video footage showed Danny Danon – his Israeli counterpart – stifling a yawn in response.

In the face of the death of Palestinian children, Israel yawns in indifference. This is unsurprising, with a recent poll showing that 82 percent of Jewish Israelis support expelling Palestinians from Gaza. How can Palestinians be told, then, to bring themselves – and their children – to Israeli military aid delivery stations and expect safety, not savagery? Will the number of 18,000 Palestinian children – whose names we may never fully know – not be enough?

In December 2023, UNICEF, the UN’s children’s agency, declared: “The Gaza Strip is the most dangerous place in the world to be a child.” On May 27, the organisation stated that “Since the end of the ceasefire on 18 March, 1,309 children have reportedly been killed and 3,738 injured. But, in Gaza, girls running from fire, pulled from the rubble and burned beyond recognition are not enough to provoke action.

In Gaza, when children are caught in the fire of relentless bombing, the world turns its back. In tears, Dr Alaa begged rescuers to let her hold her daughter one last time.

Sadly, the white shrouds wrapped around the bodies of Gaza’s children continue to mount.

Yaqeen Hammad is now one of those shrouded and buried children.

Just 11 years old, Yaqeen was one of Gaza’s youngest social media influencers. In one of her videos, while preparing food, she told the world: “In Gaza, we don’t know the word impossible.” This was her crime.

On May 23, the same day Alaa’s children were incinerated, Israel decided that Yaqeen was somehow a threat to its existence."

# Your Summary

It mentions the death of children, including five-year-old Ward Khalil, and the destruction of families. The article also references a statement by UNICEF declaring Gaza as the most dangerous place in the world for children. <image:i>

DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

# Record
## Claim

# Your Analysis



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The evidence suggests that the image is likely related to the conflict in Gaza. The geolocate tool indicates a high probability of the image being taken in Palestine or Israel. Web searches confirm that there have been Israeli airstrikes in Gaza, resulting in children being trapped in the rubble. The New Arab article mentions that images of children in the rubble have sparked international condemnation. The NBC News video and Al Jazeera article also show images of children near rubble in Gaza.

The claim states the image was taken in July 2024. However, the provided evidence does not confirm the exact date the image was taken. The PBS News article mentions the war began on October 7, 2023. The New Arab article was published on June 3, 2025. Therefore, the claim's date cannot be verified.

JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:59> This image shows a palestinian child stuck under the rubble in Gaza after an Israeli airstrike in July 2024."

## Actions
```
geolocate(<image:59>)
web_search("Palestinian child rubble Gaza Israeli airstrike")
image_search("child trapped rubble Gaza")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `geolocate`
The most likely countries where the image was taken are: {'Palestine': 0.51, 'Israel': 0.24, 'Jordan': 0.11, 'Russia': 0.02, 'Canada': 0.01, 'Colombia': 0.01, 'France': 0.01, 'Sweden': 0.01, 'Turkey': 0.01, 'Ukraine': 0.01}

### Evidence from `web_search`
PBS News reported on March 20, 2025, about a month-old girl rescued from the rubble in Gaza after an Israeli airstrike that killed her parents and brother. The war began on October 7, 2023. ([https://www.pbs.org/newshour/world/month-old-girl-pulled-from-rubble-in-gaza-after-airstrike-killed-her-parents](https://www.pbs.org/newshour/world/month-old-girl-pulled-from-rubble-in-gaza-after-airstrike-killed-her-parents))

The New Arab published an article on June 3, 2025, about a baby rescued from the rubble in Gaza after an Israeli airstrike. The article mentions that widely circulated images of the baby have sparked international condemnation of Israel's military campaign in Gaza. The article also mentions that more than 50,000 Palestinian children have been killed or wounded since October 2023. <image:59>

### Evidence from `image_search`
NBC News published a video about rescue workers fighting to save children trapped in Gaza City airstrike rubble. (<image:10680>) Al Jazeera published an article about the impact of the Israeli war on Gaza's children, which includes an image of children near rubble. (<image:10681>)

*   [https://www.nbcnews.com/video/rescue-workers-fight-to-save-children-trapped-in-gaza-city-airstrike-rubble-196401733655](https://www.nbcnews.com/video/rescue-workers-fight-to-save-children-trapped-in-gaza-city-airstrike-rubble-196401733655)
*   [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/10/19/israels-war-against-gazas-children-explained](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/10/19/israels-war-against-gazas-children-explained)


## Elaboration
The evidence suggests that the image is likely related to the conflict in Gaza. The geolocate tool indicates a high probability of the image being taken in Palestine or Israel. Web searches confirm that there have been Israeli airstrikes in Gaza, resulting in children being trapped in the rubble. The New Arab article mentions that images of children in the rubble have sparked international condemnation. The NBC News video and Al Jazeera article also show images of children near rubble in Gaza.

The claim states the image was taken in July 2024. However, the provided evidence does not confirm the exact date the image was taken. The PBS News article mentions the war began on October 7, 2023. The New Arab article was published on June 3, 2025. Therefore, the claim's date cannot be verified.


# Your Judgement



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The image is likely related to the conflict in Gaza, with evidence confirming Israeli airstrikes and children trapped in rubble. However, the exact date of the image, July 2024, cannot be verified.

PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

# Example: web_search()

## Claim
Text: "New Zealand’s new Food Bill bans gardening"
Claim date: October 29, 2020

...

## Actions
```
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill 2020")
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```

# Example: image_search()

## Claim
Text: "Chinese officials in white protective hazmat suits carried people down a hallway to be quarantined for having COVID-19 in November 2022."

...

ACTIONS:
```
image_search("China officials white suits carry people")
image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1

The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Search Result
From [Source](https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/05/1162996): 
Content: "Residents had to open a hole in the wall to evacuate the dead and wounded**,” UNRWA told _UN News_.

Since the start of the war between Hamas and Israel on 7 October 2023, **more than 400 schools have received a direct hit**, according to satellite imagery analyzed by the UN.

**Deadly aftermath**
--------------------

Footage from the scene provided by the UN agency showed walls and floors blown out in the main school building.

In the courtyard, hundreds of people could be seen standing amid crumpled metal sheeting on the morning after the attack, with rubble and wooden planks strewn around where their shelters had been standing just hours earlier.

“Our colleagues are reporting that surviving parents and children are trying to salvage their belongings among the blood and body parts of their relatives and neighbours,” UNRWA said.

The agency noted that fatalities included women and children, while search and rescue operations are ongoing for several people still missing.

Many of those living at the school when it was hit have been displaced “countless times” by the war, which began on 7 October 2023, following Hamas-led terror attacks on Israel, UNRWA stressed.

The attack also sparked a fire in an adjacent school where more tents and temporary shelters were burned and damaged.

Education destroyed
-------------------

[According to the UN Satellite Service, UNOSAT](https://reliefweb.int/report/occupied-palestinian-territory/verification-damages-schools-based-proximity-damaged-sites-gaza-occupied-palestinian-territory-update-9-may-2025)
, 95.4 per cent of schools in Gaza have sustained damage since the start of the war.

**Of the enclave’s 564 schools, 501 will either need full reconstruction or major rehabilitation work to be functional again**.

“There is no humanity left in Gaza, and no humanity left as the world continues to watch day after day as families are bombed, burned alive and starved,” UNRWA said after the latest attack.

**Failed strategy won’t work: Türk**
------------------------------------

In a related development, the [UN human rights chief](https://www.ohchr.org/en/about-us/high-commissioner)
 Volker Türk [on Wednesday condemned](https://www.ohchr.org/en/press-releases/2025/05/turk-israeli-plans-expand-gaza-offensive-aggravate-concerns-regarding)
 Israel’s reported plans to forcibly transfer Gaza’s population to a small area in the south of the Strip.

**The move fuels concern that Israel’s intention is to make life for Palestinians “increasingly incompatible with their continued existence in Gaza”**, he said in a statement.

> 'Surviving parents and children are trying to salvage their belongings among the blood and body parts of their relatives and neighbours' - UNRWA

“There is no reason to believe that doubling down on military strategies, which, for a year and eight months, have not led to a durable resolution, including the release of all hostages, will now succeed,” insisted the UN High Commissioner for Human Rights.

Expanding the offensive on Gaza “will almost certainly cause further mass displacement, more deaths and injuries of innocent civilians, and the destruction of Gaza’s little remaining infrastructure”, he continued.

**Rights experts warn of irreversible consequences**
----------------------------------------------------

Escalating atrocities in Gaza mark a critical moral turning point and demand urgent international action, UN-appointed independent human rights experts said [in a statement](https://www.ohchr.org/en/press-releases/2025/05/end-unfolding-genocide-or-watch-it-end-life-gaza-un-experts-say-states-face)
.

“**While States debate terminology – is it or is it not genocide? The independent experts are appointed by the [Human Rights Council](https://www.ohchr.org/EN/HRBodies/HRC/Pages/Home.aspx)
, are not UN staff members and receive no salary for their work.

![Aftermath of a 6 May Israeli airstrike on an UNRWA school turned shelter in Al Bureij, Gaza where 30 people were reported killed, among them women and children.](https://global.unitednations.entermediadb.net/assets/mediadb/services/module/asset/downloads/preset/Collections/Embargoed/07-05-2025-UNRWA-Gaza-Bureij-01.jpg/image1024x768.jpg "Aftermath of a 6 May Israeli airstrike on an UNRWA school turned shelter in Al Bureij, Gaza where 30 people were reported killed, among them women and children.")

© UNRWA

Aftermath of a 6 May Israeli airstrike on an UNRWA school turned shelter in Al Bureij, Gaza where 30 people were reported killed, among them women and children.

**Occupied West Bank update**
-----------------------------

In the occupied West Bank, meanwhile, UN aid teams warned of worsening conditions for Palestinian communities **because of “violence by Israeli forces and settlers”**.

The alert comes after Israeli forces on Monday demolished more than 30 structures in Khallet Athaba, a hamlet in Hebron governorate, displacing nearly a dozen families – or around 50 people.

“This constitutes most of the structures in the community and marks the third and largest demolition there since February,” said UN aid coordination office, [OCHA](https://www.unocha.org/)

New horror in Gaza as double strike on school shelter kills 30
==============================================================

     ![Hundreds of schools sheltering displaced families in Gaza have received direct hits since the war began on 7 October 2023 following Hamas-led terror attacks on Israel.](https://global.unitednations.entermediadb.net/assets/mediadb/services/module/asset/downloads/preset/Libraries/Production%20Library/10-10-2023_UNRWA_Gaza_school.jpg/image1170x530cropped.jpg "Hundreds of schools sheltering displaced families in Gaza have received direct hits since the war began on 7 October 2023 following Hamas-led terror attacks on Israel.")

© UNRWA

Hundreds of schools sheltering displaced families in Gaza have received direct hits since the war began on 7 October 2023 following Hamas-led terror attacks on Israel.

[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/05/1162996 "Share this via Facebook")
 [Twitter](https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=New horror in Gaza as double strike on school shelter kills 30&url=https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/05/1162996 "Share this via Twitter")
 Print [Email](mailto:?subject=New horror in Gaza as double strike on school shelter kills 30&body=https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/05/1162996 "Share this via Email")

New horror in Gaza as double strike on school shelter kills 30
==============================================================

**By** **Daniel Johnson**

7 May 2025 [Peace and Security](/en/news/topic/peace-and-security)

Grim details emerged on Wednesday of Israeli airstrikes on a UN-run school in Gaza sheltering 2,000 displaced people, which reportedly killed 30 Palestinians sheltering there.

The UN agency for Palestine refugees, [UNRWA](https://www.unrwa.org/)
, maintained that Israeli forces hit the school in Al Bureij, Middle Gaza, at around 6pm on Tuesday and again at 10.20pm.

Tweet URL

> [](https://twitter.com/UN_News_Centre/statuses/1920237213368877263)

“**The school sustained severe damage and a fire broke out in the shelter, making it difficult to evacuate the casualties. – Israel continues its relentless destruction of life in Gaza**,” they warned, citing attacks by land, air and sea, and a soaring civilian death toll.

“No one is spared – not children, persons with disabilities, nursing mothers, journalists, health professionals, aid workers, or hostages,” they said, noting that on 18 March alone, 600 Palestinians were reportedly killed, 400 of them children. They are among more than 100 buildings slated for demolition, following an Israeli notice issued at the start of the month.

**Forcible transfer fears**
---------------------------

OCHA described how dozens of families in the camp were given little time on Monday to collect their belongings before their homes were demolished.

The agency highlighted the “strong push” to uproot Palestinians living in the area “**once again raising concerns about the risks of forcible transfer of the population**”.

Under international law, Israel as the occupying power, has the responsibility to protect Palestinians in the West Bank and ensure their safety and dignity, OCHA insisted.

Humanitarian partners are mobilizing assistance, but urgent international engagement is needed to stop these coercive measures and protect vulnerable communities, the UN aid office said.

♦ Receive daily updates directly in your inbox - [**Subscribe here**](https://news.un.org/en/content/un-newsletter-subscribe?utm_source=UN News&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=un_news_newsletter)

♦ Download the UN News app for your [**iOS**](https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/un-news-reader/id496893005?mt=8)
 or [**Android**](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=org.un.mobile.news&hl=en)
 devices.

*   [Gaza](/en/tags/gaza)
    

[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/05/1162996 "Share this via Facebook")
 [Twitter](https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=New horror in Gaza as double strike on school shelter kills 30&url=https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/05/1162996 "Share this via Twitter")
 Print [Email](mailto:?subject=New horror in Gaza as double strike on school shelter kills 30&body=https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/05/1162996 "Share this via Email") It noted that the area is designated by Israel as a military training zone.

In addition, Israeli forces also began demolishing six homes in Nur Shams refugee camp in Tulkarm on Monday, impacting 17 families."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The UN News article, published on May 7, 2025, reports on an Israeli airstrike on a UN-run school in Al Bureij, Gaza, which was sheltering displaced people. The attack, which occurred on May 6, 2025, reportedly killed 30 Palestinians, including women and children. <image:10682> The article also mentions that since the start of the war between Hamas and Israel on October 7, 2023, more than 400 schools have received a direct hit. The article includes a photo of the aftermath of the airstrike.

[Leave your feedback](https://www.pbs.org/newshour/about/contact-us/)

Nine of a doctor’s 10 children are killed in latest Israeli strikes in Gaza, health officials say
=================================================================================================

[World](https://www.pbs.org/newshour/world)
 May 24, 2025 6:47 PM EDT

CAIRO (AP) — The bodies of 79 people killed by Israeli strikes have been brought to hospitals in the past 24 hours, Gaza’s Health Ministry said Saturday, a toll that doesn’t include hospitals in the battered north that it said are now inaccessible.

Nine of a doctor’s 10 children were among those killed in Israel’s renewed military offensive, colleagues and the Health Ministry said.

Alaa Najjar, a pediatrician at Nasser Hospital, was on duty at the time and ran home to find her family’s house on fire, Ahmad al-Farra, head of the hospital’s pediatric department, told The Associated Press.

[**READ MORE:** Palestinian children suffering from malnutrition overwhelm Gaza’s Nasser Hospital](https://www.pbs.org/newshour/world/palestinian-children-suffering-from-malnutrition-overwhelm-gazas-nasser-hospital)

Najjar’s husband was severely wounded and their only surviving child, an 11-year-old son, was in critical condition after Friday’s strike in the southern city of Khan Younis, Farra said.

The dead children ranged in age from 7 months to 12 years old. Khalil Al-Dokran, a spokesperson for Gaza’s Health Ministry, told the AP that two of the children remained under the rubble.

Israel’s military in a statement said it struck suspects operating from a structure next to its forces, and described the area of Khan Younis as a “dangerous war zone.” It said it had evacuated civilians from the area, and “the claim regarding harm to uninvolved civilians is under review.”

Earlier on Saturday, a statement said Israel’s air force struck over 100 targets throughout Gaza over the past day.

The Health Ministry said the new deaths brought the war’s toll to 53,901 since the Oct. and aid groups deny there is significant diversion.

Hospitals in Gaza are again reporting attacks and other Israeli pressure.

The Health Ministry said 11 security personnel have been trapped at the European Hospital in southern Gaza following heavy gunfire and airstrikes since at least Tuesday. This week, the [first aid trucks entered](https://www.pbs.org/newshour/world/netanyahu-says-hell-allow-some-aid-into-gaza-after-pressure-from-allies)
 the territory and began reaching Palestinians since the blockade began.

COGAT, the Israeli defense body overseeing aid for Gaza, said 388 trucks had entered since Monday. Hams said the security staff stayed behind to protect from looting, and that it was the only hospital in Gaza offering neurosurgery, cardiac care and cancer treatment.

Israel said it will continue to strike Gaza until Hamas releases all of the 58 remaining Israeli hostages and disarms. Netanyahu has rejected those terms and has vowed to maintain control over Gaza and facilitate what he refers to as the voluntary emigration of much of its Palestinian population.

“The Israeli government and its leader have a clear choice: deal or war, saving lives or abandonment,” Liran Berman, brother of hostages Gali and Ziv Berman, told a weekly rally in Tel Aviv as families and supporters again demanded an agreement that would bring everyone home.

_AlJoud reported from Beirut._

We're not going anywhere.

[Sally Abou AlJoud, Associated Press](https://www.pbs.org/newshour/author/sally-abou-aljoud-associated-press)
 [Sally Abou AlJoud, Associated Press](https://www.pbs.org/newshour/author/sally-abou-aljoud-associated-press)

By —

[Samy Magdy, Associated Press](https://www.pbs.org/newshour/author/samy-magdy-associated-press)
 [Samy Magdy, Associated Press](https://www.pbs.org/newshour/author/samy-magdy-associated-press) The ministry said 3,747 people have been killed in Gaza since Israel resumed the war on March 18 in an effort to pressure Hamas to accept different ceasefire terms. Its count doesn’t differentiate between civilians and combatants.

Israel’s pressure on Hamas has included a blockade of Gaza and its over 2 million people since early March. Saleh Hams, director of the nursing department, said patients were evacuated after an Israeli strike on May 13. 7 attack, in which militants killed some 1,200 people, mostly civilians, and abducted 251 others.

Hamas has said it will only return the remaining hostages in exchange for more Palestinian prisoners, a lasting ceasefire and an Israeli withdrawal from the territory."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
PBS News published an article on May 24, 2025, reporting on Israeli strikes in Gaza. The article mentions that nine of a doctor's ten children were killed in an airstrike in Khan Younis. <image:10683> The article also states that the war's toll has reached 53,901 since October.

PBS News reported on March 20, 2025, about a month-old girl rescued from the rubble in Gaza after an Israeli airstrike that killed her parents and brother. The war began on October 7, 2023. ([https://www.pbs.org/newshour/world/month-old-girl-pulled-from-rubble-in-gaza-after-airstrike-killed-her-parents](https://www.pbs.org/newshour/world/month-old-girl-pulled-from-rubble-in-gaza-after-airstrike-killed-her-parents))

The article mentions that widely circulated images of the baby have sparked international condemnation of Israel's military campaign in Gaza. The article also mentions that more than 50,000 Palestinian children have been killed or wounded since October 2023. <image:59>

## Elaboration
The evidence suggests that the image is likely related to the conflict in Gaza. The geolocate tool indicates a high probability of the image being taken in Palestine or Israel. Web searches confirm that there have been Israeli airstrikes in Gaza, resulting in children being trapped in the rubble. The New Arab article mentions that images of children in the rubble have sparked international condemnation. The NBC News video and Al Jazeera article also show images of children near rubble in Gaza.

The claim states the image was taken in July 2024. However, the provided evidence does not confirm the exact date the image was taken. The PBS News article mentions the war began on October 7, 2023. The New Arab article was published on June 3, 2025. Therefore, the claim's date cannot be verified.

* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

PBS News published an article on May 24, 2025, reporting on Israeli strikes in Gaza, including an airstrike in Khan Younis that killed nine of a doctor's ten children. The article also states that the war's toll has reached 53,901 since October. ([https://www.pbs.org/newshour/world/nine-of-a-doctors-10-children-are-killed-in-latest-israeli-strikes-in-gaza-health-officials-say](https://www.pbs.org/newshour/world/nine-of-a-doctors-10-children-are-killed-in-latest-israeli-strikes-in-gaza-health-officials-say)) <image:10683>


### Evidence from `image_search`
Save the Children published an article about children in Gaza, including an image of a child standing in front of rubble. ([https://www.savethechildren.net/stories/nowhere-safe-children-gaza](https://www.savethechildren.net/stories/nowhere-safe-children-gaza)) <image:10688> VPM.org published an article on October 7, 2024, with photos from the year since October 7, including an image of children near rubble. ([https://www.vpm.org/npr-news/npr-news/2024-10-07/photos-a-look-back-at-the-year-since-oct-7](https://www.vpm.org/npr-news/npr-news/2024-10-07/photos-a-look-back-at-the-year-since-oct-7)) <image:10689>


# Your Analysis



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The evidence confirms that the image is likely related to the conflict in Gaza, with a high probability of being taken in Palestine or Israel. The web searches and image searches provide additional context, showing that children have been affected by Israeli airstrikes, and many have been killed or wounded. However, the exact date of the image cannot be verified.

_________________________



JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:59> This image shows a palestinian child stuck under the rubble in Gaza after an Israeli airstrike in July 2024."

## Actions
```
geolocate(<image:59>)
web_search("Palestinian child rubble Gaza Israeli airstrike")
image_search("child trapped rubble Gaza")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `geolocate`
The most likely countries where the image was taken are: {'Palestine': 0.51, 'Israel': 0.24, 'Jordan': 0.11, 'Russia': 0.02, 'Canada': 0.01, 'Colombia': 0.01, 'France': 0.01, 'Sweden': 0.01, 'Turkey': 0.01, 'Ukraine': 0.01}

### Evidence from `web_search`
PBS News reported on March 20, 2025, about a month-old girl rescued from the rubble in Gaza after an Israeli airstrike that killed her parents and brother. The war began on October 7, 2023. ([https://www.pbs.org/newshour/world/month-old-girl-pulled-from-rubble-in-gaza-after-airstrike-killed-her-parents](https://www.pbs.org/newshour/world/month-old-girl-pulled-from-rubble-in-gaza-after-airstrike-killed-her-parents))

The New Arab published an article on June 3, 2025, about a baby rescued from the rubble in Gaza after an Israeli airstrike. The article mentions that widely circulated images of the baby have sparked international condemnation of Israel's military campaign in Gaza. The article also mentions that more than 50,000 Palestinian children have been killed or wounded since October 2023. <image:59>

### Evidence from `image_search`
NBC News published a video about rescue workers fighting to save children trapped in Gaza City airstrike rubble. (<image:10680>) Al Jazeera published an article about the impact of the Israeli war on Gaza's children, which includes an image of children near rubble. (<image:10681>)

*   [https://www.nbcnews.com/video/rescue-workers-fight-to-save-children-trapped-in-gaza-city-airstrike-rubble-196401733655](https://www.nbcnews.com/video/rescue-workers-fight-to-save-children-trapped-in-gaza-city-airstrike-rubble-196401733655)
*   [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/10/19/israels-war-against-gazas-children-explained](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/10/19/israels-war-against-gazas-children-explained)


## Elaboration
The evidence suggests that the image is likely related to the conflict in Gaza. The geolocate tool indicates a high probability of the image being taken in Palestine or Israel. Web searches confirm that there have been Israeli airstrikes in Gaza, resulting in children being trapped in the rubble. The New Arab article mentions that images of children in the rubble have sparked international condemnation. The NBC News video and Al Jazeera article also show images of children near rubble in Gaza.

The claim states the image was taken in July 2024. However, the provided evidence does not confirm the exact date the image was taken. The PBS News article mentions the war began on October 7, 2023. The New Arab article was published on June 3, 2025. Therefore, the claim's date cannot be verified.


## Actions
```
web_search("Gaza Israeli airstrike children rubble")
image_search("child rubble Gaza")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The UN News article from May 7, 2025, reports on an Israeli airstrike on a UN-run school in Al Bureij, Gaza, which killed 30 Palestinians, including women and children. The article also mentions that more than 400 schools have received a direct hit since the start of the war on October 7, 2023. ([https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/05/1162996](https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/05/1162996)) <image:10682>

PBS News published an article on May 24, 2025, reporting on Israeli strikes in Gaza, including an airstrike in Khan Younis that killed nine of a doctor's ten children. The article also states that the war's toll has reached 53,901 since October. ([https://www.pbs.org/newshour/world/nine-of-a-doctors-10-children-are-killed-in-latest-israeli-strikes-in-gaza-health-officials-say](https://www.pbs.org/newshour/world/nine-of-a-doctors-10-children-are-killed-in-latest-israeli-strikes-in-gaza-health-officials-say)) <image:10683>


### Evidence from `image_search`
Save the Children published an article about children in Gaza, including an image of a child standing in front of rubble. ([https://www.savethechildren.net/stories/nowhere-safe-children-gaza](https://www.savethechildren.net/stories/nowhere-safe-children-gaza)) <image:10688> VPM.org published an article on October 7, 2024, with photos from the year since October 7, including an image of children near rubble. ([https://www.vpm.org/npr-news/npr-news/2024-10-07/photos-a-look-back-at-the-year-since-oct-7](https://www.vpm.org/npr-news/npr-news/2024-10-07/photos-a-look-back-at-the-year-since-oct-7)) <image:10689>


## Elaboration
The evidence confirms that the image is likely related to the conflict in Gaza, with a high probability of being taken in Palestine or Israel. The web searches and image searches provide additional context, showing that children have been affected by Israeli airstrikes, and many have been killed or wounded. However, the exact date of the image cannot be verified.


# Your Judgement



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The image likely depicts a Palestinian child in Gaza after an Israeli airstrike, as indicated by the geolocate tool and web searches. However, the exact date of the image, July 2024, cannot be verified with the available evidence. Therefore, the claim is missing information about the date. `not enough information`

PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

# Example: web_search()

## Claim
Text: "New Zealand’s new Food Bill bans gardening"
Claim date: October 29, 2020

...

## Actions
```
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill 2020")
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```

# Example: image_search()

## Claim
Text: "Chinese officials in white protective hazmat suits carried people down a hallway to be quarantined for having COVID-19 in November 2022."

...

ACTIONS:
```
image_search("China officials white suits carry people")
image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Search Result
From [Source](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Effect_of_the_Gaza_war_on_children_in_the_Gaza_Strip): 
Content: "One employee stated; "Many of the children are missing, many get here with their skulls broken… and it’s impossible to identify them, only through that writing do they get identified."[\[91\]](#cite_note-92)
 The bodies of some children buried under rubble remained unrecovered.[\[92\]](#cite_note-93)
 In one case, a newborn was rescued from under rubble after surviving a bombing.[\[93\]](#cite_note-94)
 In another, a girl was rescued after being buried for more than 40 hours.[\[94\]](#cite_note-95)
 UNICEF has warned that the war has become a war on children, as in late December 2023 minors were estimated to account for 40% of those killed in Gaza, comparative to past conflicts were minors would be about 20%.[\[95\]](#cite_note-theguardian20231222-96)

Police also killed a 13-year-old boy and beat and fired at teenagers that tried to get supplies from aid trucks.[\[96\]](#cite_note-97)
 The former head of [Mossad](/wiki/Mossad "Mossad")
 told _[Kan](/wiki/Israeli_Public_Broadcasting_Corporation "Israeli Public Broadcasting Corporation")
_ that everyone over the age of four "supports Hamas".[\[97\]](#cite_note-98)

Warning of the joint threats of starvation and disease, a UNICEF spokesperson stated on 20 February, "The Gaza Strip is poised to witness an explosion in preventable child deaths which would compound the already unbearable level of child deaths in Gaza".[\[98\]](#cite_note-99)
 Following an Israeli airstrike on [Deir el-Balah](/wiki/Deir_el-Balah "Deir el-Balah")
, an emergency first responder stated, "We collected body parts of women and children... Per UNICEF the standard system to identify, document, trace and reunite children with relatives or siblings was barely functional in early December 2023.[\[141\]](#cite_note-bbc20231204-142)
 The UN has also estimated that about 40% of all people in Gaza have lost ID cards and documents due to the war, which has also hindered reunification and identification.[\[37\]](#cite_note-aljazeera20240215-38)

Many orphaned children recount their difficulty at processing or saying goodbye to their parents and siblings after their deaths, due to lack of funeral or memorial services, uncertainty of the future and delay at being told due to medical fragility.[\[95\]](#cite_note-theguardian20231222-96)
[\[141\]](#cite_note-bbc20231204-142)
 Humanitarian organizations reported difficulties with orphaned children who were too young to know their own names.[\[37\]](#cite_note-aljazeera20240215-38)
 Older siblings and extended family also took on responsibility for caring for their younger siblings after being orphaned.[\[142\]](#cite_note-143)
[\[143\]](#cite_note-144)

In early February 2024, UNICEF estimated that at least 17,000 children had been orphaned.[\[144\]](#cite_note-145)
 In March 2024, Israel brought 95 Palestinian orphans from [Rafah](/wiki/Rafah "Rafah")
 to the SOS Children's orphanage in [Bethlehem](/wiki/Bethlehem "Bethlehem")
 at the request of the German government.[\[145\]](#cite_note-146)
 Israeli Finance Minister [Bezalel Smotrich](/wiki/Bezalel_Smotrich "Bezalel Smotrich")
 condemned the temporary measure, stating, "Any mercy to the cruel will end up being cruel to the merciful".[\[146\]](#cite_note-147)
 By October 2024, the estimated number of orphans in Gaza had grown to 20,000.[\[147\]](#cite_note-148)

A believed to be days old infant was found in a tree near her destroyed presumed home after an Israeli airstrike killed the rest of the family in November 2023, she was known as Unknown and cared for in Emirati Hospital in Rafah, before being adopted by a pediatrician at the hospital.[\[148\]](#cite_note-149)
 A 5-year-old boy with [cerebral palsy](/wiki/Cerebral_palsy "Cerebral palsy")
 was orphaned and had grenade shrapnel lodged in his brain, after the IDF raided the family's home and executed his parents.[\[149\]](#cite_note-150)
 A 15-year-old girl was rescued from the rubble three days after an [Israeli bulldozer tore her home down](/wiki/Israeli_demolition_of_Palestinian_property "Israeli demolition of Palestinian property")
 with her family still inside, killing everyone but her.[\[150\]](#cite_note-151)
 In July 2024, the number of unaccompanied children was unknown but was likely to be above the February 2024 estimate of 17,000.[\[151\]](#cite_note-152)
 Some children were left without even extended family remaining.[\[152\]](#cite_note-153)
 In August 2024, a three-month old baby was the only survivor of an airstrike that killed her entire family.[\[153\]](#cite_note-154)
 In early-October 2024, Israel reportedly bombed the al-Amal Institute for Orphans.[\[154\]](#cite_note-155)

Displacement
------------

Main article: [Gaza Strip evacuations](/wiki/Gaza_Strip_evacuations "Gaza Strip evacuations")

On 13 November, UNICEF stated more than 700,000 children in Gaza were [displaced](/wiki/Forced_displacement "Forced displacement")
.[\[155\]](#cite_note-156)
 On 22 November 2023, UNICEF reported "increasing numbers" of [unaccompanied children](/wiki/Unaccompanied_minor "Unaccompanied minor")
 had been identified evacuating from northern to southern Gaza by themselves.[\[156\]](#cite_note-157)
 On 28 November, James Elder, a UNICEF spokesperson, stated wounded children were sheltering outdoors in [car parks](/wiki/Parking_lot "Parking lot")
 and gardens.[\[157\]](#cite_note-158)

By December 2023, Save the Children reported that it is likely that about 893,000 children were internally displaced in Gaza, average of 12,000 children a day forced to flee their homes, with some having to evacuate multiple times. Many described the separation from family members as excruciating, with some children being unable to talk to their parents, living with relatives in Gaza or having to monitor and parent younger siblings while their parents care for their injured siblings.[\[165\]](#cite_note-166)

Birth and pregnancy
-------------------

Further information: [Women in the Gaza war § Gaza Strip](/wiki/Women_in_the_Gaza_war#Gaza_Strip "Women in the Gaza war")

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2d/Damage_in_Gaza_Strip_during_the_October_2023_-_45.jpg/250px-Damage_in_Gaza_Strip_during_the_October_2023_-_45.jpg)](/wiki/File:Damage_in_Gaza_Strip_during_the_October_2023_-_45.jpg)

Wounded infant at Al-Shifa Hospital, 11 October 2023

An estimated 150 babies were born in Gaza per day since the start of the conflict.[\[166\]](#cite_note-167)
 A pediatric doctor at the Emirati Hospital in [Rafah](/wiki/Rafah "Rafah")
, stated the number of premature babies born in Gaza had risen sharply.[\[167\]](#cite_note-168)
 [Newborn babies](/wiki/Infant "Infant")
 receiving specialized care in Israel and the [West Bank](/wiki/West_Bank "West Bank")
 while their mothers were trapped in Gaza.[\[168\]](#cite_note-169)
 [Oxfam](/wiki/Oxfam "Oxfam")
 stated newborn babies were dying from preventable diseases such as infection, [hypothermia](/wiki/Hypothermia "Hypothermia")
, diarrhea, and [dehydration](/wiki/Dehydration "Dehydration")
.[\[169\]](#cite_note-170)
 By mid-December, parents were struggling to feed newborn babies, as mothers had insufficient nutrition to breastfeed.[\[170\]](#cite_note-171)
 Newborn babies born during the conflict died in airstrikes, though some were rescued from the rubble.[\[171\]](#cite_note-172)
[\[172\]](#cite_note-173)
 A [UNOCHA](/wiki/UNOCHA "UNOCHA")
 representative stated she had met a woman forced to give birth in the street, and that the baby had died.[\[173\]](#cite_note-174)
 One woman reported being unable to bathe her newborns more than ten days after their birth, due to the lack of clean water.[\[174\]](#cite_note-175)
 Mothers reported extreme difficulty locating or affording milk and diapers for their newborns.[\[175\]](#cite_note-176)

In December 2023, an Israeli shell struck the largest fertility clinic in Gaza; the explosion knocked the lids off five liquid nitrogen tanks, causing temperature within the tanks to rise and destroying more than 4,000 embryos and 1,000 specimens of unfertilized eggs and sperm. By mid-April 2024, an estimated 14,500 children in Gaza had been killed, with thousands more buried under rubble.[\[7\]](#cite_note-7)
[\[8\]](#cite_note-8)
 The UNICEF deputy director called the conditions of children in Gaza the "most horrific" he had ever seen.[\[9\]](#cite_note-unicef.org-9)
[\[a\]](#cite_note-10)
 The ongoing crisis also impacted routine vaccinations, leaving thousands of children at risk, and further compounded challenges included inadequate shelter, a lack of adequate winter coats, and the psychological toll on children's mental health.[\[10\]](#cite_note-france24live20231213-11)
[\[11\]](#cite_note-12)
 Israel was added to a UN list of entities that commit violations against children.[\[12\]](#cite_note-13)
 In late September 2024, [Oxfam](/wiki/Oxfam "Oxfam")
 and [Action on Armed Violence](/wiki/Action_on_Armed_Violence "Action on Armed Violence")
 reported that the number of children killed in Gaza over the past year was the highest recorded in a single year for any conflict worldwide in the last 20 years.[\[13\]](#cite_note-14)

Health
------

See also: [Timeline of the Gaza Strip healthcare collapse](/wiki/Timeline_of_the_Gaza_Strip_healthcare_collapse "Timeline of the Gaza Strip healthcare collapse")
 and [Healthcare in the State of Palestine](/wiki/Healthcare_in_the_State_of_Palestine "Healthcare in the State of Palestine")

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bd/Dead_infant_in_Kamal_Adwan_Hospital_28_june_2024.jpg/250px-Dead_infant_in_Kamal_Adwan_Hospital_28_june_2024.jpg)](/wiki/File:Dead_infant_in_Kamal_Adwan_Hospital_28_june_2024.jpg)

A dead infant in Kamal Adwan Hospital in 28 June 2024 as a result of the humanitarian crisis in the Gaza Strip

Since 2007, [Israel had implemented a strict land and sea blockade](/wiki/Blockade_of_the_Gaza_Strip "Blockade of the Gaza Strip")
 that had prevented items such as food and medicine from moving into the Gaza Strip, with the health system struggling before the war.[\[14\]](#cite_note-npr20231019-15)

Ahmed al-Fara, the head of pediatrics at [Nasser Medical Complex](/wiki/Nasser_Hospital "Nasser Hospital")
 in [Khan Younis](/wiki/Khan_Younis "Khan Younis")
, stated due to the lack of water during the war, he was witnessing the "most serious epidemic of [gastroenteritis](/wiki/Gastroenteritis "Gastroenteritis")
" among children he had ever seen.[\[4\]](#cite_note-aljazeeralive20231116-4)
 [Catherine M. This war and the physical and mental scars it is leaving on children is further eroding their resilience."[\[41\]](#cite_note-42)
 In July 2024, Julia Wendt, the emergency child protection coordinator with the [International Rescue Committee](/wiki/International_Rescue_Committee "International Rescue Committee")
, stated children in Gaza were suffering from nightmares and bedwetting due to the mental toll of the war.[\[42\]](#cite_note-43)
 In September 2024, children's hair was turning prematurely grey due to their high levels of stress.[\[43\]](#cite_note-44)
 In October 2024, Dr. Russell stated many children in Gaza were facing [severe acute malnutrition](/wiki/Global_Acute_Malnutrition "Global Acute Malnutrition")
.[\[53\]](#cite_note-54)
 On 5 January, UNICEF found 90 percent of children under the age of two were eating two or fewer food groups a day.[\[54\]](#cite_note-55)
 On 3 February, Hani Mahmoud, an _Al Jazeera_ journalist in Rafah, stated, "We’re seeing children roaming around in Rafah looking for scraps of food."[\[55\]](#cite_note-56)
 In early January 2024 UNICEF reported that around 90% of children in Gaza under 2 were subjected to severe food poverty, which had jumped from 80% about two weeks prior.[\[56\]](#cite_note-cnn20240108-57)

Price jumps have also been seen by those attempting to purchase food, with a caregiver purchasing through a procurement company infant formula which had cost him $1,680 before the war, but paying $2,160 in February 2024.[\[17\]](#cite_note-cnn20240130-18)
 The United Nations stated on 10 February 2024 that 10 percent of children under five-years-old were suffering from acute malnourishment.[\[57\]](#cite_note-58)
 One mother reported feeding her newborn using date paste.[\[58\]](#cite_note-59)
 On 19 February 2024, UNICEF found that nearly 16 percent of children in northern Gaza under two-years-old were "[acutely malnourished](/wiki/Global_Acute_Malnutrition "Global Acute Malnutrition")
", with 3 percent suffering from severe [wasting](/wiki/Wasting "Wasting")
.[\[59\]](#cite_note-60)
 In early March 2024 UNICEF reported that over 90% of children aged 6–23 months and pregnant or breastfeeding women face severe food poverty with access to two or fewer food groups a day.[\[60\]](#cite_note-cnn20240306-61)

Child malnutrition is varied throughout Gaza, with northern Gaza experiencing worse food shortages then southern Gaza leading to a child malnutrition rate three times higher according to the WHO.[\[60\]](#cite_note-cnn20240306-61)
 In March 2024, 10 children died at [Kamal Adwan Hospital](/wiki/Kamal_Adwan_Hospital_siege "Kamal Adwan Hospital siege")
 from dehydration and malnutrition, leading UNICEF to state, "Now, the child deaths we feared are here and are likely to rapidly increase unless the war ends and obstacles to humanitarian relief are immediately resolved".[\[61\]](#cite_note-62)
 Doctors at Kamal Adwan stated all staff could give malnourished and dehydrated newborns was saline or sugar solution, with one pediatrician stating, "My message is an appeal to the entire world to intervene and save all the children".[\[62\]](#cite_note-63)
 A severely malnourished 10-year-old boy named [Yazan al-Kafarneh](/wiki/Death_of_Yazan_al-Kafarneh "Death of Yazan al-Kafarneh")
 died from starvation.[\[63\]](#cite_note-64)
[\[64\]](#cite_note-65)
 On 6 March 2024, WHO secretary-general [Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus](/wiki/Tedros_Adhanom_Ghebreyesus "Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus")
 warned of "children who survived bombardment but may not survive a famine".[\[65\]](#cite_note-66)

The [Palestinian Red Crescent](/wiki/Palestinian_Red_Crescent "Palestinian Red Crescent")
 found parents were going without food in order to feed "their hungry children amidst food insecurity and shortage of available food".[\[66\]](#cite_note-67)
 Doctors at the Kamal Adwan Hospital stated malnourished infants in the ICU had become the "new normal".[\[67\]](#cite_note-68)
 One doctor at Kamal Adwan stated, "Babies reach critical and severe degrees of dehydration and acidemia disorders and ultimately death."[\[68\]](#cite_note-69)
 In June 2024, the director of the Kamal Adwan Hospital stated more than 200 children were at risk due to malnutrition.[\[69\]](#cite_note-70)
 A clinical nutritionist stated that due to contaminated water and a lack of food security, 90 percent of children were experiencing diarrhea, hepatitis, and other diseases.[\[70\]](#cite_note-71)
 Mothers were so malnourished they were unable to produce breastmilk to feed their newborn babies.[\[71\]](#cite_note-72)
 Children continued to die from malnutrition in August 2024.[\[72\]](#cite_note-73)

In October 2024, [Save the Children](/wiki/Save_the_Children "Save the Children")
 reported that of the approximately 3000 under five-years-old children they had screened, about 20 percent had moderate acute malnutrition and four percent had severe acute malnutrition.[\[73\]](#cite_note-74)

### Hygiene

In December 2023, [ActionAid](/wiki/ActionAid "ActionAid")
 reported that there was little water for washing and some shelters only had one shower for every 700 individuals and one toilet for every 150.[\[74\]](#cite_note-france24live20231211-75)
 UNICEF announced on 7 March 2024 that they were distributing wellbeing kits to adolescent girls in Rafah, who reported being unable to "shower more than once a week. Elderly, above 60 (6.80%)

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/62/Damage_in_Gaza_Strip_during_the_October_2023_-_42_%28cropped%29.jpg/250px-Damage_in_Gaza_Strip_during_the_October_2023_-_42_%28cropped%29.jpg)](/wiki/File:Damage_in_Gaza_Strip_during_the_October_2023_-_42_(cropped).jpg)

Wounded child at al-Shifa Hospital, October 2023

### Dead and missing

By 3 December, an estimated 6,150 children had been killed in the conflict.[\[84\]](#cite_note-85)
 More children were killed in Gaza in two and a half months than the total of children killed in all conflicts around the world in the previous three years combined.[\[85\]](#cite_note-86)
 By mid-January 2024, an estimated 10,000 children in Gaza had been killed, with thousands more buried under rubble.[\[86\]](#cite_note-87)
 By 5 February 2024, [Defense for Children International](/wiki/Defense_for_Children_International "Defense for Children International")
 estimated that 12,100 children had been killed in Gaza.[\[87\]](#cite_note-88)
 Children have been killed in Israeli airstrikes, even in areas deemed a "safe zone" by the IDF, such as when a family of twelve were killed in a safe zone in Mawasi in southern Gaza, of which 10 were children.[\[18\]](#cite_note-pbs20240104-19)
 In March 2024, the United Nations stated that more children had died in Gaza between October 2023 and February 2024 than the sum of all global conflicts from 2019 to 2022.[\[88\]](#cite_note-89)
 [Catherine M. Russell")
, the head of UNICEF, stated, "We haven’t seen that rate of death among children in almost any other conflict in the world".[\[89\]](#cite_note-90)
 In June 2024, [Save the Children](/wiki/Save_the_Children "Save the Children")
 stated approximately 21,000 children were missing in Gaza, including 4,000 children believed to be buried under rubble.[\[90\]](#cite_note-91)

Some parents reported speaking to their children about what to do if one or both of their parents were killed, such as where important documents are and where to find aid or shelter.[\[14\]](#cite_note-npr20231019-15)
 Hospital and emergency workers in Gaza noted that parents and relatives of some children wrote on children's bodies, mostly on their legs and abdomens, so the children would be identifiable if found in the rubble or get lost. **[^](#cite_ref-3)
    ** ["PRCS tries to 'alleviate suffering of displaced children'"](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/liveblog/2023/11/12/israel-gaza-war-live-israeli-army-surrounding-al-quds-hospital?update=2480667)
    . **[^](#cite_ref-34)
    ** ["Children in Gaza have paid the highest price in this crisis: Save the Children"](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/liveblog/2024/1/28/israels-war-on-gaza-live-aid-cuts-are-collective-punishment-unrwa?update=2655790)
    ."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The Wikipedia article "Effect of the Gaza war on children in the Gaza Strip" discusses the impact of the conflict on children, including deaths, injuries, and displacement. The article mentions that many children have been killed in Israeli airstrikes, with some buried under rubble. It also highlights the challenges faced by orphaned children, including difficulties in identification and reunification. The article provides statistics on child deaths and malnutrition, and it mentions the lack of access to basic necessities like food, water, and hygiene. The article also mentions that in July 2024, the number of unaccompanied children was likely to be above the February 2024 estimate of 17,000.

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:59> This image shows a palestinian child stuck under the rubble in Gaza after an Israeli airstrike in July 2024."

## Actions
```
geolocate(<image:59>)
web_search("Palestinian child rubble Gaza Israeli airstrike")
image_search("child trapped rubble Gaza")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `geolocate`
The most likely countries where the image was taken are: {'Palestine': 0.51, 'Israel': 0.24, 'Jordan': 0.11, 'Russia': 0.02, 'Canada': 0.01, 'Colombia': 0.01, 'France': 0.01, 'Sweden': 0.01, 'Turkey': 0.01, 'Ukraine': 0.01}

### Evidence from `web_search`
PBS News reported on March 20, 2025, about a month-old girl rescued from the rubble in Gaza after an Israeli airstrike that killed her parents and brother. The war began on October 7, 2023. ([https://www.pbs.org/newshour/world/month-old-girl-pulled-from-rubble-in-gaza-after-airstrike-killed-her-parents](https://www.pbs.org/newshour/world/month-old-girl-pulled-from-rubble-in-gaza-after-airstrike-killed-her-parents))

The New Arab published an article on June 3, 2025, about a baby rescued from the rubble in Gaza after an Israeli airstrike. The article mentions that widely circulated images of the baby have sparked international condemnation of Israel's military campaign in Gaza. The article also mentions that more than 50,000 Palestinian children have been killed or wounded since October 2023. <image:59>

### Evidence from `image_search`
NBC News published a video about rescue workers fighting to save children trapped in Gaza City airstrike rubble. (<image:10680>) Al Jazeera published an article about the impact of the Israeli war on Gaza's children, which includes an image of children near rubble. (<image:10681>)

*   [https://www.nbcnews.com/video/rescue-workers-fight-to-save-children-trapped-in-gaza-city-airstrike-rubble-196401733655](https://www.nbcnews.com/video/rescue-workers-fight-to-save-children-trapped-in-gaza-city-airstrike-rubble-196401733655)
*   [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/10/19/israels-war-against-gazas-children-explained](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/10/19/israels-war-against-gazas-children-explained)


## Elaboration
The evidence suggests that the image is likely related to the conflict in Gaza. The geolocate tool indicates a high probability of the image being taken in Palestine or Israel. Web searches confirm that there have been Israeli airstrikes in Gaza, resulting in children being trapped in the rubble. The New Arab article mentions that images of children in the rubble have sparked international condemnation. The NBC News video and Al Jazeera article also show images of children near rubble in Gaza.

The claim states the image was taken in July 2024. However, the provided evidence does not confirm the exact date the image was taken. The PBS News article mentions the war began on October 7, 2023. The New Arab article was published on June 3, 2025. Therefore, the claim's date cannot be verified.


## Actions
```
web_search("Gaza Israeli airstrike children rubble")
image_search("child rubble Gaza")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The UN News article from May 7, 2025, reports on an Israeli airstrike on a UN-run school in Al Bureij, Gaza, which killed 30 Palestinians, including women and children. The article also mentions that more than 400 schools have received a direct hit since the start of the war on October 7, 2023. ([https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/05/1162996](https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/05/1162996)) <image:10682>

PBS News published an article on May 24, 2025, reporting on Israeli strikes in Gaza, including an airstrike in Khan Younis that killed nine of a doctor's ten children. The article also states that the war's toll has reached 53,901 since October. ([https://www.pbs.org/newshour/world/nine-of-a-doctors-10-children-are-killed-in-latest-israeli-strikes-in-gaza-health-officials-say](https://www.pbs.org/newshour/world/nine-of-a-doctors-10-children-are-killed-in-latest-israeli-strikes-in-gaza-health-officials-say)) <image:10683>


### Evidence from `image_search`
Save the Children published an article about children in Gaza, including an image of a child standing in front of rubble. ([https://www.savethechildren.net/stories/nowhere-safe-children-gaza](https://www.savethechildren.net/stories/nowhere-safe-children-gaza)) <image:10688> VPM.org published an article on October 7, 2024, with photos from the year since October 7, including an image of children near rubble. ([https://www.vpm.org/npr-news/npr-news/2024-10-07/photos-a-look-back-at-the-year-since-oct-7](https://www.vpm.org/npr-news/npr-news/2024-10-07/photos-a-look-back-at-the-year-since-oct-7)) <image:10689>


## Elaboration
The evidence confirms that the image is likely related to the conflict in Gaza, with a high probability of being taken in Palestine or Israel. The web searches and image searches provide additional context, showing that children have been affected by Israeli airstrikes, and many have been killed or wounded. However, the exact date of the image cannot be verified.


## Actions
```
web_search("Gaza child rescue rubble date")
image_search("Gaza child rescue rubble")
```

A month-old girl is pulled from the rubble in Gaza after an airstrike killed her parents
========================================================================================

A month-old girl is pulled from the rubble in Gaza after an airstrike killed her parents
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
